Like with any other online content, you want to be careful when choosing an online text for studying. However, there are plenty of open texts available nowadays that could be used for studying without a problem.

I use the Bergstrom's open textbook for Molecular & Cellular Biology in my own classroom. https://bio.libretexts.org/Bookshelves/Cell_and_Molecular_Biology/Book%3A_Basic_Cell_and_Molecular_Biology_(Bergtrom)
calm down lol

Yes, they follow along with my schedule for the course. The chapters are taught in different order than they are present in the book itself though. Each lecture starts with a slide that lets you know which chapters from the Alberts books are used in that lecture.
